intro: Cosmostigma cordatum, commonly known as the heartleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its botanical features make it a unique and attractive addition to horticultural collections.
